questions.question_text:
A cloud administrator has finished setting up an application that will use RDP to connect. During testing, users experience a connection timeout error.
Which of the following will MOST likely solve the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
open tcp on 3389

choices.B: Migrate the equipment to the cloud

questions.question_text:
A systems administrator notices that a piece of networking equipment is about to reach its end of support.
Which of the following actions should the administrator recommend?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
hahaha the answer is D.

Selected Answer: D
D-Replace the equipment: This is the MOST recommended action when networking equipment is approaching its end of support. Replacing the aging hardware ensures continued reliability, security, and access to vendor support. Newer equipment often offers improved features and performance.
as for B, it would not make sense to migrate one piece of network equipment to the cloud.
When something is at "End of Support", that means no more updates are available. So, A and C are out. I am doing with D

Selected Answer: D
It cant be A, its end of support so there will be no update, I would go with D as we're talking about network equipment you wouldn't move your network equipment to the cloud and keep your servers on premises.
Don't think answer A is correct! Probably D?

choices.D: Create a dedicated subscription for the businesses to manage the costs
choices.A: Perform segregation of the VLAN and capture egress and ingress values of each network interface
choices.B: Tag each server with a dedicated cost and sum them based on the businesses
choices.C: Split the total monthly invoice equally between the businesses

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Tag is solution if you don't know how to use cloud.
Best practice invites you to separate subscriptions.
similar to AWS Organizations, its better to have them separated then use consolidated billing. D is the answer.

Selected Answer: D
D. Create a dedicated subscription for the businesses to manage the costs is the best method for resolving this issue. By creating dedicated subscriptions, the organization can have separate billing, cost management, and access control for each business. This will provide better visibility and accuracy of costs for each business and make it easier to allocate costs and track usage. The other options may provide some level of cost tracking, but they will not be as accurate and may not provide detailed cost visibility or control.

Selected Answer: D
Why wouldn't you separate the business accounts along with this issue it would also remove how much of a loss the Organization would have if one of the businesses got sued, unless I'm misunderstanding something.

questions.question_text:
An organization has two businesses that are developing different software products. They are using a single cloud provider with multiple IaaS instances. The organization identifies that the tracking of costs for each business are inaccurate.
Which of the following is the BEST method for resolving this issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
That's not easy to understand the meaning of "Incorrect billing account", maybe your account can only send 10.000 e-mail, but reading the question seems like suddenly happened, and nothing predictable.

"Misconfigured auto-scaling" and "Bandwidth limitation" are not SaaS configuration.

"API request limit", considering you are using an internally managed CRM, can be the best answer; A lot of services puts limits and quotas on API requets from receiving more thata that it can handle and to ensure an equitable distribuction of system resources (i.g. https://developers.google.com/analytics/devguides/reporting/core/v3/limits-quotas )

Correct answer: A Google puts limits and quotas on API requests to protect the system from receiving more data than it can handle, and to ensure and equitable distribution of system resources. https://developers.google.com/analytics/devguides/reporting/core/v3/limits-quotas

questions.question_text:
A marketing team is using a SaaS-based service to send emails to large groups of potential customers. The internally managed CRM system is configured to generate a list of target customers automatically on a weekly basis, and then use that list to send emails to each customer as part of a marketing campaign. Last week, the first email campaign sent emails successfully to 3,000 potential customers. This week, the email campaign attempted to send out 50,000 emails, but only 10,000 were sent.
Which of the following is the MOST likely reason for not sending all the emails?

A systems administrator disabled TLS 1.0 and 1.1, as well as RC4, 3DES, and AES-128 ciphers for TLS 1.2, on a web server. A client now reports being unable to access the web server, but the administrator verifies that the server is online, the web service is running, and other users can reach the server as well.
Which of the following should the administrator recommend the user do FIRST?

choices.C: Establish a VPN tunnel between the computer and the web server
choices.D: Update the web browser to the latest version

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Obviously the only valid answer is D: update de webbrowser/operating system to the latest version

Selected Answer: D
D. You don't fix, a security fix by creating another security hole, update the browser.
